On Tuesday 07 June 2005 19:59, Jeff Nielsen wrote:
> We do use CVS for all of our projects here and don't suffer from the kinds
> of issues Chris talks about either.  I can't imagine a simple checkin or
> update taking long enough that you would have time to read mail or news. 
> We also rename checked-in classes almost daily, and the only CVS issue
> there is "losing" easy access to the file's history.
>
> Surely the CVS slowness (is the server remote?) is one of the real issues
> to be addressed in Chris's situation.  Interesting how a "technical" issue
> like that can drive the kinds of refactorings people are willing/able to
> do.

The CVS server is remote; specifically, it's SourceForge.

It occurs to me to wonder if it's really the server, or if there's some
network issue between here and there. (The experience is the same, but
some things are, in principle, easier to fix ...)

-- 
Chris "electric hedgehog" Dollin
It's called *extreme* programming, not *stupid* programming.
